titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Lofton Michell, William Bogard, and Futrell Foard, Indictment
CWG6894

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Trigg Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } August Term 1865.
Loflin Michell William Bogar Futrell Foard

The Grand Jury of Trigg Count in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Loftin Michell William Bogard and Futrell -- of the Offense of unlawfully carrying away property Committed as follows viz. The said Loftin Michell William Bogard and Futrell Foard on the 10th day of September 1864 in the County aforesaid, did willfully Knowingly and unlawfully, but not with felonious intent take and carry away Two Guns and Three Mules all of the value of Six hundred Dollars $600. the property of John C Whitlock and J. S. McNichols and against the will and consent of said Whitlock & McNichols and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

W Wharton
Foreman Grand Jury
E. P. Campbell
Attorney for the Commonwealth

Information given by
John C Whitlock
J. S. McNichols
George W Craig
George Watwood
Benjamin Bell
Jonathan Rodgers
Col Jeff Gentry

Comth
vs } Indictment for Trespass
Loflin Michell &c.
a True bill
W Wharton
foreman Grand Jury

Returned into Court and filed 2d September 1865. (26') Series of Copy's issued to Febry Term 1866
A True Copy.
Att R. A. Burnett C T C C
